175.article_body: Hours after ED carried out searches in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy case, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said he has nothing to hide and did his job "honestly". If ED officers come to my place, they'll only find maps of some schools, Sisodia added. Notably, around 30 locations across various states including Delhi and Telangana are being raided.

176.title: Priyanka urges people to join Bharat Jodo Yatra, says want to solve problems
176.article_body: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged people to join partyâs Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is slated to cover a distance of around 3,500 km. âWe are starting a positive politics. We want to hear from you, we want to solve your problems. We want to unite our beloved country. Letâs unite India together,â said Priyanka.

177.title: Kejriwal to start nationwide tour for 'Make India No 1' campaign tomorrow
177.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he'll begin his nationwide tour as part of 'Make India No 1' campaign from his birthplace Hisar in Haryana tomorrow. He said that it's the "dream" of 130-crore people to see India become "the best country". However, he said that the country can't progress until every child receives quality education for "free".

178.title: CBI questions TMC MLA Paresh Pal in murder of BJP worker in Kolkata
178.article_body: The CBI questioned TMC MLA Paresh Pal in connection with its investigation into the murder of BJP worker Abhijit Sarkar in post-poll violence in Kolkata. âWe have specific questions for Pal in connection with the murder of Sarkar. These questions have been framed after grilling a few others,â a CBI officer said.

179.title: Are citizens lower priority?: Tharoor on armed CISF cover to RSS offices
179.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday questioned the Centre's decision to abolish over 3,000 CISF posts at airports while RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed CISF cover. "So, tax-paying citizens who are passengers in public airports are a lower priority for CISF deployment than a private non-governmental organisation?" Tharoor tweeted.

180.title: Can resolve all problems with PM Modi at helm in India: B'desh PM
180.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India and Bangladesh can resolve all their problems as long as PM Narendra Modi is at the helm. "Our main aim is to develop the economy and fulfil the basic needs of our people. With friendship, you can solve any problem," PM Hasina said.

181.title: 5 of family, including 3 kids, killed as car overturns in Ludhiana
181.article_body: At least five members of a family, including three kids, were killed after the car they were travelling in overturned on the Ludhiana-Chandigarh highway. The accident took place when the driver lost control and the car hit a wall before overturning. Among the deceased, two were aged five, one was aged three, one was aged 35 and another 30.

182.title: DreamFolks shares list at premium, gain 56% from IPO price
182.article_body: DreamFolks Services shares on Tuesday listed at a premium of 56% above their issue price at â¹508 apiece on the NSE from the initial public offering (IPO) price range of â¹308-326. On the BSE, the stock began trading at â¹505 a share, a premium of 54.9%. The â¹562-crore IPO of the airport service aggregator was subscribed 56.7 times last month.

183.title: Taimur, Jeh should respect that woman of the house also works: Kareena
183.article_body: Speaking about Taimur and Jeh, actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said they have to grow to understand that both of their parents work so that they can have a good life. "They should respect that the woman of the house also works. They should know...their mother...goes to work...This is how my boys will have to be brought up," she added.

184.title: Instagram user calls Cobra's screenplay 'confusing', director says 'sorry'
184.article_body: Ajay Gnanamuthu, writer-director of the recently released movie 'Cobra' starring Vikram, responded to an Instagram user who said the film's screenplay was quite confusing. Ajay replied, "Firstly sorry that you felt confused!! But me as an audience I've always liked watching mind-bending films and genuinely tried it this time!! If possible [please] try watching it again hopefully you like it."

185.title: Virat shouldn't say such things in middle of Asia Cup: Madan Lal
185.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's remark that no one texted him except MS Dhoni when he left Test captaincy, ex-India all-rounder Madan Lal said that the 33-year-old shouldn't make such comments in the middle of the Asia Cup. "Even if someone calls or doesn't call, if you're in trouble you have to work on it...Ego shouldn't clash here," stated Lal.

186.title: Greta criticises Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis during polls
186.article_body: Climate activist Greta Thunberg criticised Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis before September 11 election. Thunberg pointed out that the issue had been "pretty much non-existent...we have been completely focusing on other things" during the election campaign. She cited Pakistan's example, where monsoon rains and melting glaciers triggered floods, affecting 33 million people.

187.title: 5 Shiv Sena workers tear down BJP banners in Mumbai, booked
187.article_body: The Mumbai Police have registered a case against five Shiv Sena workers for allegedly tearing down banners put up by BJP workers in the Lower Parel area of the city, officials said on Tuesday. BJP workers had put up the banners in the run-up to the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections and the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

188.title: India adopted leadership role in fight against climate change: Union Minister
188.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Tuesday said India has adopted a leadership role in the fight against climate change with its climate actions exceeding its moral and legal responsibility. Developed countries are progressing at the cost of their developing counterparts, Yadav said and added that India has contributed only around 4% of global cumulative emissions since pre-industrial era.

189.title: India is biggest market for exports from B'desh across Asia: PM
189.article_body: Addressing a joint press briefing with his Bangladeshi counterpart Sheikh Hasina, PM Narendra Modi said, "Across Asia, India is the biggest market for exports from Bangladesh." "To further expedite this progress, we will soon initiate discussions on a bilateral economic comprehensive partnership agreement," PM Modi added. Notably, Bangladesh PM Hasina began her four-day visit to India on Monday.

190.title: Solomon Islands calls Aus' offer to fund election 'inappropriate'
190.article_body: The Solomon Islands government said it appreciates Australia's offer to fund next election but the timing is "inappropriate". Australia extended the offer after the Solomon Island's PM Manasseh Sogavare said that authorities cannot fund the Pacific Games and an election in the same year. "This is an assault on our parliamentary democracy," the Solomon Islands government said in a statement.

191.title: DreamFolks Services records Q1 profit at â¹13.4 cr, revenue up 545%
191.article_body: Airport service aggregator DreamFolks Services recorded consolidated net profit for the June quarter at â¹13.43 crore, compared to a loss of â¹1.38 crore in the corresponding period last year. The total revenue surged to â¹160.46 crore, which is a 545.47% jump from last year. The company got listed on the BSE and NSE at a premium of 56% on Tuesday.

192.title: Pressure is on India, this could also be Pakistan's year in Asia Cup: Sehwag
192.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka, Virender Sehwag said, "If India lose another match, they'll be out of...Asia Cup." He added, "Pakistan have the advantage because if they lose one match and win another, their net run rate will take them to the final...pressure is on India...This could also be Pakistan's year."

193.title: Over 30 Telangana students fall ill, allege dead lizard found in food
193.article_body: Over 30 students of a government-run girls' hostel in Telangana's Warangal fell ill after having dinner. Reports said that one of the students alleged that she saw a dead lizard in the food but that the catering staff said it was a green chilli. Students reportedly started vomiting soon after. Officials said that they have ordered an inquiry.

194.title: Hungary to create anti-graft body in an attempt to unlock EU funds
194.article_body: To oversee the spending of European Union funds, Hungary will create an anti-corruption authority and a working group involving non-government organisations. The move is aimed at unlocking funds as the Hungarian government is facing a stand-off with Brussels over corruption, migration and other issues. Hungary has been awaiting European Commission's approval to draw on money to lift its economy.

195.title: Narayana Hrudayalaya stock rises to 4-month high amid acquisition plan
195.article_body: A day after Narayana Hrudayalaya announced plans to acquire a 100-bed orthopaedic and trauma hospital at Bengaluru's Narayana Health City campus for â¹200 crore, the shares of the hospital chain surged more than 5% to a four-month high of â¹744 apiece on Tuesday. The shares of the Bengaluru-based company were trading at â¹720 apiece at 3:07 pm.

196.title: Fawad Khan, former cricketer Wasim Akram to star in 'MBG'
196.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan is all set to share screen space with former cricketer Wasim Akram in a film titled 'Money Back Guarantee' (MBG). The actor took to Instagram on Tuesday to announce the project. Fawad, who was recently seen in 'Ms. Marvel', has also worked in several Bollywood films, including 'Kapoor & Sons', 'Khoobsurat' and 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil'.

197.title: CPI leader D Raja praises Nitish Kumar, says time to fight unitedly
197.article_body: CPI Leader D Raja hailed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for breaking ties with BJP and for trying to unite the Opposition for 2024 Lok Sabha polls. âTime has come that all secular democratic parties, Left parties, and regional parties must come together and fight unitedly to defeat BJP in the interest of the country and its future,â said Raja.

198.title: Hindu right-wing groups involved in terrorist activities: Ex-RSS worker
198.article_body: A former Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker has alleged that Hindu right-wing groups such as RSS, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal are engaged in terrorist activities for BJP's political gain. He has also moved an application before the Nanded court, claiming that a VHP leader was directly involved in the Nanded blast case.

199.title: Video shows 3 kids sitting in moving car's boot in Hyd; police take action
199.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video showing three children, including a girl, sitting in the boot of a moving car in Hyderabad and tagged the concerned authorities. The kids were playing with a toy, while adults accompanying them were sitting on the seats. After seeing the video, the Cyberabad Traffic Police verified it and issued a challan.

200.title: Rich nations pledge $25 bn to help Africa adapt to climate change
200.article_body: Rich countries will provide $25 billion to Africa by 2025 to help the continent adapt to climate change, according to officials at a climate summit. President of the African Development Bank, Akinwumi A Adesina, told DW News that Africa is distressed by climate change. "Africa will need $1.3-$1.6 trillion this decade to implement climate goals" Adesina said at the summit.

201.title: Kohli shares 'Notice people' quote amid controversy over 'No one messaged me' remark
201.article_body: Amid controversy over his remark that none of his former teammates barring MS Dhoni messaged him after he quit Test captaincy, Virat Kohli shared a quote on Instagram. The quote read, "Notice the people who are happy for your happiness, and sad for your sadness. They're the ones who deserve special places in your heart." "Word," Kohli captioned the post.

202.title: Google advises users to update Chrome browser to avoid hacking risk
202.article_body: Google has advised its users to quickly install a security update in its Chrome browser to safeguard themselves against a bug being actively exploited by hackers. We're aware that an exploit for 'CVE-2022-3075' exists in the wild, Google added. "Access to bug details and links may be kept restricted until majority of users are updated with a fix," Google said.

203.title: Modernise all govt schools in one go, take states on board: Kejriwal to PM
203.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday urged PM Modi to modernise all government schools across the country instead of doing it in instalments. Kejriwal also urged Centre to take state governments on board in formulating a plan for the same. His comments came after PM Modi announced PM-SHRI Yojana to develop 14,500 schools as model schools, equipped with modern infrastructure.

204.title: No non-teaching duties for teachers: Maharashtra CM Shinde
204.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that no non-teaching duties, except for work which is of national importance, will be assigned to teachers in the state. "I have been receiving a number of complaints and applications regarding non-educational work being assigned to teachers," he added. "Instructions regarding the same will be given to the department," Shinde further said.

205.title: Call 112 or tag us on Twitter to report unmanned barricades: Delhi Police
205.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday told the High Court that people can either dial 112 or tweet tagging the Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) and Delhi Police (@delhipoliceon) to report any unmanned barricades on the roads in the national capital. Police informed the court that no barricades on roads would be left unattended and ensured immediate action on such complaints.

206.title: 11 persons cheated of â¹2 cr in investment fraud in Mumbai, 1 held
206.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a software engineer, 34-year-old Kishan Katnhar, and booked two others for allegedly cheating 11 investors of over â¹2 crore on the pretext of giving huge returns on their investment. According to the complainant, 28-year-old Mohammed Irfan Khan, along with his family members invested over â¹92 lakh with the accused between November 2016 to December 2017.

207.title: Iran demands closure of IAEA probe for revival of 2015 nuclear deal
207.article_body: Tehran wants the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to drop its probe against Iran's nuclear activities as a guarantee for the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, the Iranian foreign ministry said on Monday. The US has already rejected linking the IAEA probe with the pact. Uranium traces found at three undeclared Iranian nuclear sites had triggered the probe.

208.title: Stock up supplies, prepare bomb shelters: Ukraine to Crimea residents
208.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have asked residents of Russia-annexed Crimea to prepare bomb shelters and stock up supplies like water and charge power banks. The announcement comes as Kyiv prepares to launch a counteroffensive against Russian troops to drive them out of the Ukrainian territory. Russia annexed Crimea in 2014, however, the territory is still internationally recognised as a part of Ukraine.

209.title: DNA proof submitted against former inspector accused of rape in Hyd
209.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Monday submitted DNA evidence in a Hyderabad court against former Marredpally inspector K Nageswara Rao, who is accused of raping a woman. Opposing Rao's second bail petition, Additional Public Prosecutor Ganga Reddy said that the DNA report shows that Rao committed the crime. Rao allegedly raped a woman whose husband he had arrested in the past.

210.title: India-B'desh relations role model for neighbourhood diplomacy: B'desh PM
210.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India's bilateral relations with Bangladesh are a role model for neighbourhood diplomacy.Â "I appreciate Modi ji's visionary leadership that continues to provide added momentum to our bilateral relations," she said, adding that India is Bangladesh's most important neighbour.

211.title: Bharat Biotech's nasal COVID vaccine gets emergency use authorisation in 18+ age group
211.article_body: Bharat Biotech's ChAd36-SARS-CoV-S COVID-19 (Chimpanzee Adenovirus Vectored) recombinant nasal vaccine has been approved by the CDSCO for primary immunisation against COVID-19 in 18+ age group for restricted use in emergency situation. It is India's first nasal vaccine for COVID-19. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted, "Big boost to India's fight against COVID-19!"

212.title: TikTok denies breach after hacker group claims 2 billion users' data stolen
212.article_body: TikTok has denied claims of any data breach after a hacking forum said it had accessed the data of over 2 billion users. The hacker forum had claimed that it had accessed 790GB worth of user data, platform statistics, code, and more. A TikTok spokesperson asserted that its team "found no evidence of a security breach".

213.title: Web series on Rajiv Gandhi's assassination in the works
213.article_body: A web series based on former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination is in the works. Titled 'Trail of an Assassin', it'll be made using inputs from 'Ninety Days: The True Story of the Hunt for Rajiv Gandhi's Assassins', a recently launched book written by Anirudhya Mitra. Nagesh Kukunoor, known for directing films like 'Iqbal' and 'Dor', will helm the upcoming project.

214.title: Brendan Fraser supported me kicking off my H'wood career: Dwayne Johnson
214.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson took to Twitter and shared a video of Brendan Fraser receiving a standing ovation for his film 'The Whale'. Along with the video, Dwayne wrote he is "happy" to see Brendan receive a "beautiful ovation". "He supported me coming into his 'Mummy Returns' franchise for my first ever role, which kicked off my Hollywood career," Dwayne revealed.

215.title: Rahul Gandhi is 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu': MP Home Minister
215.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is an 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu' who visits temples when elections are near. He said that the people of Gujarat know well that Gandhi makes false poll promises. Gandhi had made the false promise of waiving farmers' loans up to â¹2 lakh in MP as well, Mishra added.

216.title: I don't even desire PM candidature: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
216.article_body: Reacting to the speculations about his PM candidature for the 2024 general elections, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "I'm not even...claimant, I don't even desire it." It's time for the Left parties, Congress and all regional parties to come together to form a united Opposition against the BJP, he said. Kumar's remarks came after he met CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury.

217.title: 'Stressed on cooperation against terrorism', says PM Modi at presser with Bangladesh PM
217.article_body: Addressing a press conference with Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Today we also stressed on cooperation against terrorism and fundamentalism." He also said, "To keep the spirit of 1971 alive, it is very necessary that we face such forces together, who want to attack our mutual trust." Notably, India and Bangladesh signed seven MoUs today.

218.title: Do I look illiterate to you?: Maharashtra minister on being trolled for his remark
218.article_body: Maharashtra Public Health Minister Tanaji Sawant, who is being trolled for allegedly mistaking Haffkine Institute for Training, Research and Testing for a person named Haffkine, criticised the media. "[Media] isn't happy that this government is being formed...Do I look like an illiterate minister to you all?" Sawant asked. He asked for proof where he said that Haffkine is a person.

219.title: Elon Musk says 90% of comments on his tweets are bots, shares screenshot
219.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted a screenshot of some comments on one of his tweets, apparently by a fake account of Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao, and wrote, "90% of my comments are bots." Musk has accused Twitter of lying about the number of bots on the platform. He's currently seeking to terminate the $44 billion merger agreement signed with Twitter.

220.title: Remote-controlled cyborg cockroach fitted with solar cell created; video released
220.article_body: Japanese scientists have created a remote-controlled cyborg cockroach that can be used to inspect dangerous areas and monitor the environment. They developed a system using an ultrasoft solar cell that doesn't hinder the cockroach's movement. The system is wired into the cockroach's nervous system and pressing a button sends a shock, tricking it into moving in a certain direction.

221.title: It's childlike atmosphere on sets: Sudhanshu on rift reports with Rupali
221.article_body: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey opened up about reports stating he has a rift with 'Anupamaa' co-star Rupali Ganguly. "My reaction is, 'Why don't you come to the sets and watch?' Simple as that," he stated. "It's absolute fun all the time. We are...running around, poking fun at each other, cracking jokes. It's a very childlike atmosphere on the sets," he added.

222.title: Thank you for giving us many moments to say 'Raina hai na': Amit Mishra
222.article_body: Reacting to ex-India batter Suresh Raina announcing his retirement from all formats of cricket, Amit Mishra tweeted, "Every cricket and IPL fan will remember you for your timely knocks which you played for the country and CSK." Mishra added, "Wish you a great retirement life ahead. Thank you for giving us many moments to say, 'Raina hai na'."

223.title: This combination isn't working: Pujara on India's playing XI in Asia Cup
223.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara said that the current playing XI combination isn't working in the Asia Cup and Axar Patel should come in along with an extra seamer into the lineup. "Hardik has been bowling well, but we can't consider him a fifth bowler. I think expecting four overs from him every time is not correct," he added.

224.title: Mumbai Police arrest 7 for providing fake documents to criminals for bail
224.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a racket where people were involved in producing fake documents to furnish bail for the undertrials in jail for serious offences. Seven people, including three women, in connection with the racket have been arrested. All female accused are homemakers, police said. Notably, the accused have submitted forged documents in Ulhasnagar, Kalyan, Nashik and Panvel courts.

225.title: KL Rahul, Athiya Shetty to marry at Suniel Shetty's Khandala bungalow: Report
225.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul and actress Athiya Shetty will marry at Suniel Shetty's bungalow Jahaan in Khandala, said reports. The date will be fixed keeping in mind the cricketer's work schedule and a wedding organiser has visited Khandala to do recce, reports added. Reacting to wedding rumours, Suniel earlier said, "The wedding will take place as soon as the kids decide."

226.title: Iâm a booster rocket that fulfilled its function: Outgoing UK PM Johnson
226.article_body: In his last address as UK PM, Boris Johnson said he's "now like one of those booster rockets that has fulfilled its function". "I'll...be gently re-entering the atmosphere and splashing down invisibly in some remote and obscure corner of the Pacific," he added. Liz Truss was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after defeating Indian-origin Rishi Sunak.

227.title: My face isn't good enough to be on a film's poster: Darlings actor Vijay
227.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who featured in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Darlings', said his face is "not good enough" for a film's poster, during a recent event where he was being roasted. "But in scenes, this face becomes unforgettable. All these f****rs say...I'm not a star...That's strange because they cast me in...films to get that extra star in...reviews. I'm that star," he added.

228.title: No vacancy for PM post: RS Prasad after Nitish Kumar meets Rahul Gandhi
228.article_body: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Congress' Rahul Gandhi, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Had Nitish Kumar been proactive in developing Bihar like he is for his personal ambition, many Bihari youth would have got employment opportunity." "There's no vacancy for the PM post and many Opposition leaders are already standing in the queue. You too stand," Prasad added.

229.title: First-class passengers in Mumbai can upgrade passes to travel in AC locals: CR
229.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that first-class local train passengers can travel in AC local trains by upgrading their quarterly passes. The pass holders need to pay the difference amount in fare while upgrading the ticket. The difference will be calculated for the period from when the upgrade was made till the date of expiry, the Railway officials said.

230.title: BSF foil smuggling bid, recover heroin worth â¹22.65 cr in Punjab
230.article_body: After reportedly foiling a smuggling attempt by Pakistan-based smugglers, troops of the Border Security Force (BSF) have recovered heroin worth â¹22.65 crore from a village in Punjab's Abohar. The seizure was done after BSF troops conducted a search operation based on specific inputs. In August, the BSF had recovered a cache of assault weapons along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab.

231.title: Man held with 116 grams gold in specially made undergarments at Hyd airport
231.article_body: Customs officials have arrested a passenger who was smuggling gold at the Hyderabad Airport and have seized 116 grams of gold valued at â¹6 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle gold in specially made undergarments. The customs officials did a body scan after being suspicious. A case has been registered against the passenger, reports said.

232.title: Ambulance leaves pregnant woman on UP road for failing to pay â¹1,000
232.article_body: An ambulance left a pregnant woman on the road in UP as the woman's family did not have enough money to pay them. In a video, the pregnant woman can be seen sitting on the road while her family tries to help her. The ambulance driver left her on the road as the family failed to pay â¹1,000, reports said.

233.title: Multiple cases of theft reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal
233.article_body: Multiple cases of theft of cash and phones have been reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal. Two FIRs, one by a woman reporting the theft of her mobile phone worth â¹44,000 and the other by a man reporting theft of â¹2,000 from his pocket, were filed on Sunday. Another complainant stated his mobile worth â¹19,491 was stolen on August 31.

234.title: Economist Bibek Debroy appointed Chancellor of Pune's Deccan College
234.article_body: Economist Bibek Debroy has been appointed as the Chancellor of Deccan College Post Graduate and Research Institute, Pune. He will succeed archaeologist AP Jamkhedkar. Debroy is presently the Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister. He has authored several books and also translated Sanskrit works on Indian mythological books.

235.title: Groom flees wedding reception after his first wife brings police to venue in Hyd
235.article_body: A man fled the reception party of his wedding with his second wife after his first wife reached the venue with police officers in Hyderabad. Syed Nazeer reportedly didn't inform his first wife Dr Sana Samreen about his second marriage. He allegedly sought money from her and started keeping away from her when her family couldn't pay the sum.

236.title: World no. 1 Swiatek enters her maiden quarter-final at US Open
236.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek advanced to her first US Open quarter-final after a 2-6, 6-4, 6-0 win over unseeded Jule Niemeier in fourth round. This is Swiatek's third Grand Slam quarter-final of 2022. The top seed won the match in two hours 23 minutes. Eighth seed Jessie Pegula beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-3, 6-2 in fourth round.

237.title: Oppn parties have to save country, Constitution together: CPI(M) leader
237.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday said that Opposition parties have to save the country and the Constitution together. His statement came after meeting Bihar CM Nitish Kumar in Delhi. CM Kumar said, "We have discussed that if the Left parties, regional parties in different states and Congress come together then it will be a big deal."

238.title: 313 applications get double COVID compensation in Pune: Officials
238.article_body: A total of 313 COVID-19 compensation applications have received double compensation from the Pune district, officials said. District Disaster Management officer Vitthal Banote said, "These double compensations have been due to banks depositing double amounts." Maharashtra government has declared an ex-gratia of â¹50,000 for the kin of those who lost their lives due to COVID-19 in the state.

239.title: Traffic restrictions in parts of Delhi for Central Vista inauguration on Sept 8
239.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police announced large-scale traffic diversions and restrictions on the roads leading to the C-Hexagon in India Gate and adjoining areas on Thursday (September 8) as PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to inaugurate Central Vista Avenue. Several roads will be closed for general traffic from 6 pm to 9 pm on Thursday for VVIPs' security, the police said.

240.title: Class 11 TN girl who threw baby gave birth in school toilet, cut umbilical cord with pen
240.article_body: The 16-year-old Class 11 girl, who allegedly threw her newborn baby in bushes in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district, gave birth alone in her school's toilet, police said. "The girl allegedly cut the umbilical cord herself using a pen and came back to the classroom," an official said. The baby's body was found by another student.

241.title: Ability only for changing names of roads: RJD MP over renaming Rajpath
241.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha reacted to Centre's announcement that Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. "What to say when there's silence on people-oriented concerns...ability is only to change roads' names?" Jha tweeted. "Today's biggest challenges like unemployment...if it has positive effect then everything is acceptable," Jha added.

242.title: India, Bangladesh sign 7 MoUs in presence of PM Modi, Sheikh Hasina
242.article_body: India and Bangladesh on Tuesday signed seven MoUs in presence of PM Narendra Modi and Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina. MoUs were signed in many sectors including water sharing, flood mitigation, defence and others. "Today, we've signed an important agreement regarding water-sharing of Kushiyara River," PM Modi said. "We've decided to extend cooperation in IT, space and nuclear sectors," he added.

243.title: This isn't a new thing for me: Amitabh Bachchan on having 5 releases in 2022
243.article_body: On being asked about having five releases in 2022, actor Amitabh Bachchan said that this is not a new thing for him. "We had multiple releases in a month back in the day. I have had 7-8 films released in a year," he added. He starred in 'Jhund' and 'Runway 34' and will be seen in 'BrahmÄstra', 'Goodbye' and 'Uunchai'.

244.title: Shopee rescinded dozens of job offers in last 2 weeks: Report
244.article_body: E-commerce firm Shopee has rescinded dozens of job offers in the past two weeks after its parent firm Sea reported rising losses and slower revenue growth, Reuters reported. Shopee withdrew the offers days before the people were due to begin work. "Due to adjustments to hiring plans...a number of roles at Shopee are no longer available," a Shopee representative said.

245.title: PM Modi to visit Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday
245.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit the Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday on September 17. "On...same day, Cheetahs from South Africa will be brought to the park," said Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Notably, the BJP will celebrate PM Modi's birthday from September 17 for a period of 16 days as "Seva Pakhwara" (service fortnight).

246.title: Met Muhammad Ali for a film, ended up getting a punch: Big B
246.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled his meeting with American boxer Muhammad Ali at the latter's Beverly Hills residence in Los Angeles. The actor said, "Producer-director Prakash Mehra ji wanted to make a film with Muhammad Ali and me...That film never got made but I ended up getting a punch." He further called the boxer "a wonderful human being".

247.title: Neither ruled myself in nor out: Tharoor on Cong President post
247.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he has neither ruled himself in nor out of the election to the President's post to the party. "I hope many will contest in order to give the membership a wide choice," he said. The leadership vacuum at the top has had a damaging effect within the party, he added.

248.title: Senior citizen on morning walk robbed, attacked with sharp weapon in Pune
248.article_body: A senior citizen was reportedly robbed of his phone and attacked with a sharp weapon by three men in Pune's Kharadi on Thursday. According to police, Babam Dahifale, 60, was on a morning walk when three persons on a motorcycle tried to snatch his cell phone. As Dahifale resisted, one of the accused attacked him, injuring his leg and abdomen.

249.title: Actors possibly work the least while making a film: Rakul Preet Singh
249.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that actors "possibly work the least" while making a film. Rakul further stated that assistant directors to light-men work for "14-15 hours" a day during filmmaking. She added, "It's just for them that you want to go and watch the film in a theatre." The actress recently featured in 'Cuttputlli' and 'Runway 34'.

250.title: Lucknow hotel had iron grills on windows, no one could escape during fire: FIR
250.article_body: Lucknow's Hotel Levana, where a fire had broken out on Monday, had iron grills on windows, FIR registered in the case said. The FIR reportedly added that due to the iron grills, no one could come out from the window during the fire incident and that the fire brigade had difficulty breaking windows.

251.title: 'Thiruchitrambalam' earns â¹100cr, becomes Dhanush's highest earner
251.article_body: Dhanush-starrer Tamil film 'Thiruchitrambalam' has collected over â¹100 crore at the worldwide box office, becoming the highest earning film of the actor's career. The film, which also stars Nithya Menen, Raashii Khanna, Prakash Raj, Bharathiraja and Priya Bhavani Shankar, features Dhanush in the role of a food delivery boy. The actor was last seen in Hollywood film 'The Gray Man'.

252.title: Minority is not allowed errors: Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt support Arshdeep
252.article_body: Celebrities Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt and Angad Bedi supported cricketer Arshdeep Singh after he was trolled over his dropped catch in India-Pakistan Asia Cup match. Varun tweeted in Hindi, "Minority is not allowed to make human errors. They should always remain perfect. Majority will take care of imperfections." Pooja wrote, "Society cannot cannibalise success and conveniently discard failures."

253.title: J'khand Congress chief calls BJP 'bachcha chor' after trust vote
253.article_body: A day after Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren won the trust vote, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur on Tuesday called the BJP 'bachcha chor' or thieves of children. "Our MLAs were not going anywhere. BJP destabilises the country's non-BJP state governments and we always take precautions because they are like 'bachcha chor'," said Thakur.

254.title: Hyd to get 23-km long solar roof cycle track by 2023, KTR shares video
254.article_body: Hyderabad will have a 23-km long cycle track with a solar roof by 2023, Telangana Minister of Municipal Administration and Urban Development, KT Rama Rao, announced on Twitter. While sharing a video, he said that he will be laying the foundation of the project on Tuesday. "Plan to deliver it before summer 2023," he wrote.

255.title: It will always remain special to me: Omung Kumar on 8 years of 'Mary Kom'
255.article_body: Filmmaker Omung Kumar on Monday took to Instagram to share a series of still and behind-the-scenes pictures to mark eight years since the release of 'Mary Kom'. He wrote alongside the pictures, "My first directorial film 'MARY KOM'. Thank you to everyone who made this possible." The Priyanka Chopra-starrer is a biographical sports film based on boxer Mary Kom.

256.title: I think India might bring in another finisher vs Sri Lanka: Sehwag
256.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka today, Virender Sehwag said India might include wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in the playing XI. "If you have brought in Karthik at the age of 37...then he should play till the World Cup," stated Sehwag. Karthik played in India's first two games in the Asia Cup.

257.title: Shah to visit Hyderabad on Sept 17 to celebrate Liberation Day
257.article_body: To celebrate Hyderabad Liberation Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah will attend an inaugural programme as a chief guest on September 17 in the city. "The celebrations will be organised throughout the year under the auspices of the Central Department of Culture to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the state," said Union Minister G Kishan Reddy.

258.title: Need to upgrade infrastructure: T'gana minister KTR amid B'luru flooding
258.article_body: After heavy rains lashed Bengaluru, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao made a slew of observations regarding the flooding situation in the city. "With rapid urbanisation and sub-urbanisation, infrastructure is bound to crumble as we haven't infused enough capital into upgrading the same," he tweeted. KTR said that India needs bold reforms in urban planning and governance.

259.title: Husband allegedly murders wife over dowry in Ghaziabad; arrested
259.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly murdering his wife at his house in Ghaziabad. The wife's uncle claimed that the accused beat her with a baseball bat and later strangled her with a piece of cloth on Sunday night. "The womanâs family has alleged that their daughter was killed for dowry," an assistant superintendent of police said.

260.title: â¹1,500 crore released for draining of water in Bengaluru: Karnataka CM
260.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that his government has given â¹1,500 crore for draining of water in Bengaluru as the city is facing waterlogging problems due to heavy rainfall. He further said that â¹300 crore has been given to remove encroachments. "We have taken it as a challenge. Our officers, engineers and SDRF team are working 24/7," he added.

261.title: BJP MLAs to meet President to demand dismissal of Delhi government
261.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs will meet President Droupadi Murmu in the national capital today to demand dismissal of AAP government over corruption allegations against party leaders. The legislators will also submit a memorandum to the President. Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly Ramvir Singh Bidhuri claimed that the AAP had used abusive language against Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

262.title: Truck hits BJP MLA Nitesh Rane's car on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
262.article_body: A truck hit a car in which Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane and his family members were travelling on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, police said. No one was injured in the accident which took place at Urse toll plaza on the expressway, police added. "We have booked the truck driver under relevant sections of the IPC," an official said.

263.title: Dog bites child in Ghaziabad society's lift as its owner looks on, video surfaces
263.article_body: A CCTV footage of an incident where a woman's pet dog bites a child in the elevator of a housing society in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad as the woman looks on and does nothing has surfaced online. In the video, the child is seen rubbing the injured area in pain. The child's parents registered a police complaint regarding the incident.

264.title: Will be supporting Truss every step of the way: Outgoing UK PM Johnson
264.article_body: In his last address as UK PM, Boris Johnson said that he's "now like one of those booster rockets that has fulfilled its function". Johnson vowed to support PM-elect Liz Truss "every step of the way". He and Truss will now travel to Scotland, where he'll offer his resignation to Queen Elizabeth II, after which she'll appoint Truss as PM.

265.title: 17-yr-old boy hit by train while recording Instagram Reel in Telangana; video goes viral
265.article_body: A video showing a 17-year-old boy getting hit by a train in Telangana while recording an Instagram Reel has gone viral on social media. The boy was severely injured in the incident. The boy could be seen getting hit by the train from behind as he was walking very close to the track near Kazipet Railway Station in Hanumakonda district.

266.title: Pak food app shares meme after Team India's defeat, Zomato says 'Use your own template'
266.article_body: After Pakistan defeated India on Sunday, Careem Pakistan, a food delivery app, shared a meme from the movie 'Hera Pheri' while tagging food delivery app Zomato and tweeted in Hindi, "We were just calling to place an order." Meanwhile, Zomato replied to their meme and wrote, "Meme template tou apne use karo (At least use your own meme template)."

267.title: There is no bravado in speeding: Hansal Mehta after Cyrus Mistry's death
267.article_body: After the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, filmmaker Hansal Mehta wrote on Twitter, "There is NO bravado in speeding." He shared about his near-fatal accident in Fiji 30 years ago when his car dropped from a height. "I was speeding. I was wearing a seat belt. I escaped an accident that would have surely ended my life."

268.title: Impact of Afridi's sixes in 2014 Asia Cup match: Hafeez on Ashwin not playing
268.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez termed Shahid Afridi's two consecutive sixes in the last over of an India-Pakistan match in Asia Cup 2014, bowled by Ravichandran Ashwin, as the reason why Ashwin hasn't featured recently against Pakistan. Afridi's sixes helped Pakistan chase down a 246-run target. Ashwin didn't feature in both games played so far against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022.

269.title: Actress Archana seen crying, shouting at Tirupati staff; claims they demanded bribe
269.article_body: Actress Archana Gautam, who is also a Congress leader, alleged on Monday, September 5, that Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams officials had asked her for a bribe to allow her darshan. She was seen crying and shouting at staff in a video that she posted on Twitter. "In the name of VIP darshan, â¹10,500 is taken," she alleged.

270.title: Volkswagen to list Porsche in one of the biggest IPOs in years
270.article_body: Volkswagen will be listing Porsche in one of the biggest initial public offerings in years. It intends to list Porsche in Frankfurt and offer 25% of Porsche's preferred stock to private investors in a public offering aimed for late September or early October. Porsche SE has agreed to purchase the shares at the IPO price plus a 7.5% premium.

271.title: Unacademy CEO's family, pet evacuated on a tractor in B'luru, says 'things are bad'
271.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal shared a video of his family and pet dog being evacuated on a tractor in Bengaluru after heavy rainfall in the city led to waterlogging in many areas. "Our society [is] now submerged. Things are bad. Please take care," Munjal tweeted. Earlier, upGrad CEO Arjun Mohan said he went to office on a tractor on Monday.

272.title: Taiwanâs military more powerful now due to Chinese drills: Prez Tsai
272.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Tuesday said that recent Chinese military drills around the island have helped improve Taiwan's combat abilities. "Our national military's combat skills are more mature and its combat power is more powerful," she added. China conducted several drills around Taiwan in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taipei last month.

273.title: Trending on Twitter isn't cool, don't want to be social media star: Shehnaaz
273.article_body: During an interview, actress Shehnaaz Gill said trending on Twitter isn't cool. "It's one thing to be famous...be a social media star and another thing to be an artist. I want to be an artist," she stated. Shehnaaz added she doesn't want to be a social media influencer. "I want to be someone who can inspire people," Shehnaaz said.

274.title: Action recommended against 22 engineers, officers after Lucknow hotel fire
274.article_body: The Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) has submitted its initial probe report on the fire that broke out in Hotel Levana in Lucknow on Monday. The report has recommended action against 22 engineers and zonal officers for allegedly conniving with the builder and ignoring illegal construction activity. Reports earlier said that the hotel will be sealed and demolished.

275.title: British man arrested in Goa for possessing drugs worth â¹15 lakh
275.article_body: A 76-year-old British man has been arrested for allegedly possessing illegal drugs worth â¹15.48 lakh in Goa, an official said on Tuesday. The police seized 12.2 grams of ganja, 40 ecstasy tablets, 80 grams of MDMA and several capsules of LSD during a raid on a property rented by him in Arambol beach village.

276.title: Tom Cruise stands atop flying plane without harness; Twitter users react on video
276.article_body: A video showing Hollywood actor Tom Cruise standing atop an airborne plane without any harness for the upcoming Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning Part 1 is going viral online. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user said, "Tom cruise is absolutely INSANE, love that for him." "I literally screamed when the planes dropped," said another.

277.title: Delhi winter pollution plan by Sept 15: Environment Minister Gopal Rai
277.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said that all agencies and government departments have been asked to submit suggestions by September 7 on how to tackle the winter air pollution. A detailed action plan will be shared by September 15, Rai added. The first report on the functioning of the Connaught Place smog tower will also be released on September 15.

278.title: Noida Metro Rail corridor to soon connect Sector 142 with Botanical Garden
278.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has submitted a detailed project report to Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) on building a corridor which will link the Botanical Garden station on Blue and Magenta Line with Sector 142 station on Aqua Metro Line. As per reports, construction has already begun on the corridor.

279.title: Delhi Police arrests man who raped, cheated constable of â¹28 lakh
279.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has arrested a 28-year-old man who allegedly posed as a Major in the Indian Army and raped and cheated a female constable of â¹28 lakh. The accused reportedly attacked and locked police officers in a room with the help of others when they went to arrest him in Bihar. Later, police arrested the accused in Jharkhand.

280.title: Musk criticises Amazon's 'Rings of Power', says 'Tolkien turning in his grave'
280.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has criticised Amazon's 'The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power' based on a novel by JRR Tolkien. "Tolkien is turning in his grave...Almost every male character so far is a coward, a jerk or both. Only Galadriel is brave, smart and nice," Musk tweeted. Amazon has reportedly spent $1 billion on this series.

281.title: Amazon planning to enter Japanese prescription drug market: Report
281.article_body: Amazon.com is mulling entering the prescription drug sales market in Japan by partnering with small and mid-sized pharmacies, the Nikkei newspaper reported. Electronic prescriptions would be allowed for the first time in Japan starting next year and that is when the company is planning the foray. The Japanese government sets the prices for prescription drugs in the country.

282.title: Bengal bags int'l tourism award for 'Best Destination for Culture'
282.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that the state has won the International Travel Award 2023 for 'Best Destination for Culture'. The award will be conferred by Pacific Area Travel Writers Association, an affiliate of the UN World Tourism Organization on March 9 next year in Berlin. Banerjee will attend the ceremony.

283.title: Tiafoe was better than me, that's why I'm having plane back home: Nadal
283.article_body: After being knocked out of the US Open, Rafael Nadal said he doesn't want to make any excuses for his defeat against Frances Tiafoe. "We need to be enough critic with [ourselves]...At the end, the only thing that happened is...I faced a player [who] was better than me. And that's why I'm having a plane back home," he stated.

284.title: 4 of 7 food samples from Delhi AIIMS hostel messes fail safety test
284.article_body: Officials from Delhi food safety department, who inspected the hostel messes at Delhi AIIMS, said food samples collected from the institute have failed the food safety test. "At least four samples out of seven...have failed the test," officer Ranjit Singh said, adding, notices will be issued to mess contractors. Report of eight more samples is yet to arrive, Singh added.

285.title: Oil prices surge 4% as OPEC+ agrees to marginal cut in production
285.article_body: Oil prices surged by 4% on Monday amid the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies agreeing to a marginal production cut by 1,00,000 barrels per day for October to boost prices. Brent crude futures for November delivery rose by 3.8% to $96.55 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate crude increased by 3.6% to $89.98.

286.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal's death ruled a suicide
286.article_body: The death of Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal, who jumped from his 18th-floor apartment in NYC's 'Jenga Building', has been ruled a suicide, NYC Medical Examiner's Office said. Arnal died from "multiple" blunt force trauma. He left no note behind and did not say anything to his wife, who was home at the time, WNBC reported citing sources.

287.title: Charmme Kaur takes break from social media after 'Liger' failure
287.article_body: Actress-producer Charmme Kaur announced that she is taking a break from social media, writing in a statement, "Chill guys! Just taking a break...@PuriConnects will bounce back Bigger and Better...Until then, Live and let Live." This comes after 'Liger', which was produced by Charmme along with Karan Johar, Puri Jagannadh, Apoorva Mehta and Hiroo Yash Johar, failed at the box office.

288.title: S Korea faces losing half its population every generation: Musk
288.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said, "South Korea is currently tracking to lose about half its population roughly every generation." His comments followed a tweet which said South Korea plans to give every family with a newborn child a monthly allowance of $740. "Long lifespan hides the dire nature of the problem," Musk added discussing South Korea's population issue.

289.title: Liquor-addicted Hyderabad man stabs wife to death in front of her family
289.article_body: A man stabbed his wife to death in front of her family members in Hyderabad. Reports said the couple used to fight frequently and the woman had shifted to her mother's place recently. On Monday, the man went to his wife under the pretext of discussing family matters. He stabbed her, following which, she died due to loss of blood.

290.title: Malaysian contractor linked to US Navy bribery scandal escapes house arrest
290.article_body: A Malaysian businessman at the heart of a massive bribery scandal involving the US Navy has escaped house arrest, authorities said. Leonard Francis, known as "Fat Leonard", had pleaded guilty in 2015 to bribing US Navy officers in exchange for lucrative military contracts. Francis had cut off his GPS bracelet and fled from his home on Sunday morning, officials said.

291.title: Man suffers cardiac arrest before doctor in Maha, he saves his life; video goes viral
291.article_body: A video of a doctor saving a man's life who suffered a cardiac arrest in Maharashtra's Kolhapur has gone viral. The man is seen feeling uncomfortable and tapping on a table following which the doctor rushes to thump on his chest. Rajya Sabha MP Dhananjay Mahadik, who shared the video on Twitter, identified the doctor as Kolhapur cardiologist Arjun Adnaik.

292.title: 60-year-old man attacked after he resists mobile theft bid in Pune
292.article_body: A 60-year-old man was severely injured after three men allegedly attacked him with a sickle when he resisted a mobile theft bid in Pune's Kharadi, police said. The trio managed to escape with the mobile, police added. The man was taking a morning walk while listening to the news when the incident occurred. No arrests have been made yet.

293.title: What message does he want: Sunil Gavaskar on Virat Kohli's 'Only MS Dhoni messaged' remark
293.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's statement that out of his former India teammates, only MS Dhoni messaged him after he quit Test captaincy, Sunil Gavaskar said, "What message did he want?" He added, "Encouragement? But then he's done with captaincy...so why would he need encouragement?" Gavaskar further said Kohli should name the players who didn't message him.

294.title: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's last rites held in Mumbai
294.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away after his car met with an accident on Sunday, was cremated at the Worli crematorium in Mumbai. The 54-year-old executive was en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai when the car he was travelling in hit a divider in Maharashtra's Palghar district. Mistry is survived by his wife Rohiqa and two children.

295.title: 'Black' actress Ayesha Kapur to make lead debut in 'Hari-Om'
295.article_body: Actress Ayesha Kapur, who portrayed the younger version of Rani Mukerji in 2005 film 'Black', will be making her leading debut in 'Hari-Om' opposite Anshuman Jha. Ayesha has reportedly been working on her Hindi diction for nearly six months with language coach Kulvinder Bakshish. The film, which also features Raghuvir Yadav and Soni Razdan, will go on floors in September.

296.title: Filmmaker playing blame games: Rakesh on discussion on reducing actors' fees
296.article_body: While talking about discussion on fees that actors and actresses charge for their films and opinions saying they should reduce it, actor and filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said that filmmakers are playing blame games. "Big actors add to the film in many ways. That's why filmmakers cast them. But the actors get blamed when the film doesn't do well," he added.

297.title: Cool to see new era, I don't think it'll be 'Big 3' now: Tiafoe after win over Nadal
297.article_body: After defeating Rafael Nadal in the fourth round of the ongoing US Open, world number 26 Frances Tiafoe said it's "cool to see a new era" in tennis. "I don't think it will be a 'Big Three'. It'll be like a big 12. There's a bunch of guys playing great tennis," he added. Tiafoe defeated Nadal 6-4, 4-6, 6-4, 6-3.

298.title: Come and post from your real accounts if you've courage: Shami to people abusing Arshdeep
298.article_body: Cricketer Mohammad Shami has defended Arshdeep Singh after the latter got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022. "Come and post from your real accounts if you have courage. Anyone can post from fake accounts," Shami said, referring to the trolls. "I'll only say to Arshdeep, donât let this hamper you," he added.

299.title: SRK to shoot for Salman Khan's 'Tiger 3' in September: Report
299.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly be shooting for a "special sequence" in Salman Khan-starrer 'Tiger 3' by the end of September. Currently, Shah Rukh is shooting for Atlee's 'Jawan' and Salman is shooting for 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. As per earlier reports, Salman will also have a cameo in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan'.

300.title: Irresponsible statement: Union Minister on J'khand CM's 'incidents happen' remark
300.article_body: Reacting to Jharkhand CM Hemant Sorenâs "incidents happen" remark over a tribal girlâs rape and murder in Dumka, Union Minister Arjun Munda called the statement "irresponsible". "Instead of saying the police in the area will hold accountability and action will be taken against the culprit, Hemant Soren made an irresponsible statement. This is very shameful," Munda said.

301.title: Army truck hits bike from behind in Haryana; 17-year-old boy dead
301.article_body: A 17-year-old boy died and his friend was injured after an Army truck allegedly hit his bike in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The deceased's father, who was riding on another bike behind the duo, claimed that the truck overtook the two-wheeler and hit them from behind. "The driver fled the spot and left the truck behind," the deceased's father added.

302.title: Manoj Bajpayee called after watching me in Delhi Crime 2: Jatin Goswami
302.article_body: 'Delhi Crime 2' actor Jatin Goswami revealed Manoj Bajpayee called him after watching his performance in the show. "To get a call from him is a big deal. He liked my work," Jatin further added. Talking about his 'Delhi Crime 2' co-star Shefali Shah, Jatin said, "I didn't have any scenes with her...I've been a huge fan of her work."

303.title: Policeman injured at Pune hospital as criminal undergoing treatment attacked
303.article_body: A policeman deployed at Pune's Sassoon Hospital got injured after a criminal undergoing treatment was attacked by unidentified suspects with sharp weapons, police said. The criminal is linked to the outfit Hindu Rashtra Sena, police added. "A police guard deployed at the ward sustained injuries on the hand trying to stop the attackers," police stated.

304.title: UP school principal kills self after being tortured by loan sharks
304.article_body: A 45-year-old principal of a primary school allegedly died by suicide in his office after being tortured by loan sharks in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj, police said. The police added that in a suicide note, which was found lying beside him, the deceased held three people responsible for his death. A probe has been initiated, the district's SP said.

305.title: Mahindra praises people seen travelling on excavator in flooded B'luru; criticised
305.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday shared a video while praising people who were seen travelling on an excavator in flooded Bengaluru. Mahindra wrote, "Where there is a will, there's a way." Reacting to his post, a Twitter user wrote, "Hardly anything to celebrate" and another commented, "[Your] first thought should be why the civic authority has failed".

306.title: Pregnant woman carried on bamboo stretcher for 5 km in Meghalaya
306.article_body: A pregnant woman was carried on a makeshift bamboo stretcher for five kilometres to a hospital in Meghalaya's Ri Bhoi district, where she delivered a baby, said an official. The woman, suffering from high blood pressure, struggled with labour pain through the journey. "Volunteers from Jailum village took turns to carry the patient," said a hospital official.

307.title: Delhi civic body collects over â¹23 lakh as fines over mosquito breeding
307.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) issued 77,538 legal notices and filed 26,320 prosecutions or challans over mosquito breeding in the national capital. It imposed charges on 10,438 house building owners and collected â¹23,28,700 as administrative charges, the civic body said in a statement. MCD's jurisdiction reported 92 dengue cases out of 244 cases reported across Delhi by September 3, 2022.

308.title: Flights to be delayed at Bengaluru airport after heavy rainfall
308.article_body: Flights are likely to be slightly delayed today after heavy rain and due to weather conditions, Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport announced. Massive traffic jams were reported in the city as several areas remained severely waterlogged. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that this was the highest rainfall in Bengaluru in last 32 years, adding that 164 lakes have been filled.

309.title: New York would've been like B'luru if it received such rainfall: K'taka min
309.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Health and Family Welfare K Sudhakar said the situation in New York would have been the same as Bengaluru if it received the same amount of heavy rainfall. "Whose fault is it that hundreds of villages have been merged into Greater Bengaluru without being developed?" Sudhakar said. He added that complaining is easier than solving a problem.

310.title: 6 booked for robbing family of over â¹2 lakh in Greater Noida
310.article_body: Police have booked at least six unidentified people for reportedly breaking into a home in Greater Noida, taking a family hostage and fleeing with items worth more than â¹2 lakh. The incident took place around 2:30 am on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. "Police will arrest the suspects at the earliest,â said Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

311.title: Delhi policewoman seen slapping father-in-law in front of mother in viral video; booked
311.article_body: A case has been registered against a sub-inspector in Delhi after a video showing her slapping her father-in-law multiple times in front of her mother and colleague went viral. The video shows the man pushing the policewoman's mother when she slapped him at his house. Delhi Police said information has been shared with concerned authority to take suitable departmental action.

312.title: ED raids 30 locations in several states in connection with Delhi Excise Policy case
312.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted raids at over 30 locations in Delhi and multiple cities in Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Telangana and Maharashtra in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy case. ED in Delhi searched businessman Sameer Mahandru's Jor Bagh residence and in Gurugram, it raided the premises of Amit Arora, director of Buddy Retail Pvt Limited.

313.title: Nitish Kumar meets Rahul Gandhi in Delhi, discusses 2024 polls
313.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Delhi and discussed the strategy to unite the Opposition for 2024 Lok Sabha polls. According to reports, Kumar expressed gratitude to the Congress leader for his support. "If the Opposition will get united, then a good atmosphere will be created. I have no desire...(to become the PM)," said Kumar.

314.title: NGT directs NHAI to plant 80,000 saplings near Gurugram-Rewari highway
314.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to locate a land within 10 km of the Gurugram-Rewari national highway project for planting 80,000 saplings as a compensatory afforestation. The NGT said that it will be the responsibility of the projectâs promoter to find a suitable land for planting the trees.

315.title: Suresh Raina retires from Indian Premier League
315.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina has retired from Indian Premier League (IPL). The former CSK batter told Dainik Jagran that he has taken No Objection Certificate (NOC) from Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) and has informed BCCI about the same. "I am now free to feature in foreign T20 leagues," the 35-year-old said.

316.title: Every cricketer wants to win game for his country, no one plays to lose: Arshdeep's father
316.article_body: Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh's father Darshan Singh has said, "Every cricketer wants to win the game for his country. No one plays to lose." After India lost against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super 4 game, the 23-year-old pacer was abused on social media for dropping Asif Ali's catch. "Arshdeep will only get mentally stronger after this," his father added.

317.title: Nadal knocked out by world no. 26 Frances Tiafoe in US Open 4th round
317.article_body: Rafael Nadal was knocked out of the US Open following a 4-6, 6-4, 4-6, 3-6 defeat in the US Open's fourth round against American tennis player and world number 26 Frances Tiafoe. Nadal suffered a defeat in a Grand Slam for the first time in 2022, having entered the match with a 22-0 record in Grand Slams this year.

318.title: Karthik did not face a ball, still lost his place in the lineup: Inzamam
318.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he observed a sense of "panic" in the selection of Team India's lineup for the recent match against Pakistan, which they lost. "India...were under pressure...Dinesh Karthik did not face a ball and still lost his place in the playing XI," added Inzamam. Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht said India may have "lost their sleep" following the loss.

319.title: Ashwin should play: Karim on India's playing XI against Sri Lanka
319.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said spinner Ravichandran Ashwin should be included in India's playing XI against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match today. "Unfortunately, Deepak Hooda will have to miss out. [But] they must go back to playing with a combination of five bowlers and Hardik Pandya as the sixth bowling option," added Karim.

320.title: MP writes letter to Scindia over rise in air fares during Onam
320.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP V Sivadasan wrote a letter to Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia over the rise in air fares during Onam festival. âAhead of Onam, air carriers are jacking up the fares on select routes based on demand. This has affected both domestic and international travellers. Ticket prices from Thiruvananthapuram to other cities have skyrocketed,â Sivadasan said.

321.title: I am laughing at all these tweets: Arshdeep to parents after being abused for catch drop
321.article_body: After he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan, Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh told his parents, "I'm laughing at all these tweets and messages." "I am only going to take positives from it. This incident has only given me more confidence," he further said. Earlier, his father said, "Fans get emotional and say a few words."

322.title: Severe head trauma, injuries to vital organs led to Mistry's death: Autopsy
322.article_body: Autopsies revealed that the deaths of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and his friend Jehangir Pandole were caused by "severe head trauma and multiple external and internal injuries to vital organs". Mistry sustained major head trauma along with multiple fractures in the chest, head region, thigh and neck, said a doctor at JJ hospital, where the autopsies were conducted.

323.title: Sanjana posts message after calling a troll 'chomu aadmi' over comment on pic with Bumrah
323.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah's wife, TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan, posted a message on Instagram after she called a troll "chomu aadmi" over his comment on her picture with the Team India bowler. "While I do think it's important to stand up to internet trolls and bullies, I don't agree with dragging someone's religion, nationality, ethnicity or identity into the matter," she wrote.

324.title: I don't want to be in politics anymore: TMC leader Tapas Roy
324.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Tapas Roy said he wants to quit politics and would let his party know about his decision at an appropriate time. "There comes a time when one needs to hang up their boots...I too have to call it a day," he added. Roy is a five-time MLA who had served as councillor of Kolkata Municipal Corporation.

325.title: Drunk Indian-origin ambulance driver jailed for causing accident in S'pore
325.article_body: A 27-year-old Indian-origin man was sentenced to two years in prison in Singapore for driving an ambulance under the influence of alcohol and causing an accident in which one person was injured. G Mohanavarooman Oyyappan reportedly had 183 mg of ethanol in every 100 ml of his blood, over double the prescribed drink-driving limit of 80 mg per 100 ml.

326.title: Adani meets Bangladesh PM, commits to power transmission line by Dec
326.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani met Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in New Delhi on Monday. Taking to Twitter, Adani called her vision for Bangladesh "inspirational and stunningly bold". He also said that Adani Power is committed to commissioning its 1,600 MW Godda Power Project in Jharkhand and dedicated transmission line to Bangladesh by Bijoy Dibosh, i.e. December 16, 2022.

327.title: Govt to sell Hindustan Zinc's residual stake in tranches: Report
327.article_body: The government is not likely to sell its residual 29.54% stake in the Vedanta-controlled Hindustan Zinc (HZL) all at once, instead in tranches, an official source said. The Centre's stake is valued at around â¹36,000 crore, based on the current market price of the company's shares. Meanwhile, bankers will soon begin road shows for the offer for sale (OFS).

328.title: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Arvind Giri passes away due to heart attack
328.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Bharatiya Janata Party MLA Arvind Giri passed away due to a heart attack on Tuesday. Reports said Giri was being taken to Lucknow for treatment when he passed away near Sitapur. State Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath condoled his demise. "May Lord Shri Ram grant departed soul a place at his feet...and strength to...the bereaved family member," he said.

329.title: Boycott B'wood is regressive, everything we earn goes into economy: Abhishek
329.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bajaj in an interview called the trend of boycott Bollywood "very regressive", adding that it impacts the trickle-down effect on the economy. "The money the industry earns eventually goes into the economy. We are losing on that," he added. The actor further said that instead of cancel culture, the hashtag should be "support the talent".

330.title: Robbers chop off 75-year-old woman's leg to steal anklet in Rajasthan
330.article_body: At least two men entered the house of a 75-year-old woman and chopped off one of her legs to steal her silver anklet in Rajasthan's Bundi district. The victim was alone at home and sleeping when the robbers tried to suffocate her. She was declared to be in a critical state by local doctors and referred to a Kota hospital.

331.title: 'Brahmastra' gets U/A certificate; runtime to be 2 hours, 46 minutes
331.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' with a U/A certificate. The film, which will be releasing on September 9, is set to have a runtime of 2 hours, 46 minutes, and 54 seconds. 'Brahmastra', directed by Ayan Mukerji, will also feature Amitabh Bachchan.

332.title: Rauf's last over vs India was match-winning: Pak bowling coach Tait
332.article_body: Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait has said Haris Rauf's last over during India's innings in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match was "match-winning". "Rauf has been working so hard on his yorkers and slower balls...And his execution in the last over was perfect," added Tait. Rauf bowled three dots to Virat Kohli and conceded 10 runs in the over.

333.title: F*ck your hostage video: Chris Rock on Will Smith's apology for slap
333.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock during his stand-up show in London commented on actor Will Smith's apology video for slapping him onstage at the 2022 Oscars. The comedian said in his set, "F*ck your hostage video...Yes, that sh*t hurt." Will had posted an apology video on social media in July, saying that Chris has not responded to his attempts to reach out.

334.title: Trump once tried to pay a lawyer he owed $2 mn with a horse, book claims
334.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump once tried to pay a lawyer he owed $2 million with a horse supposedly worth $5 million, a new book by New York Times journalist David Enrich claimed. Enrich in the book, 'Servants of the Damned', said the lawyer was initially too stunned by the offer to speak but eventually retorted, "This isn't the 1800s."

335.title: 200 km roads unswept in Gurugram after civic body fails to pay fuel bills
335.article_body: At least 200 kilometres of roads in Gurugram have not been swept since Friday morning after the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) failed to clear the fuel bills of 13 road-sweeping machines. The civic body owes a total of â¹16 lakh to various fuel pump owners and the amount has remained unpaid for the past 12 months, officials said.

336.title: 26 prisoners test HIV positive at UP's Barabanki district jail
336.article_body: As many as 26 prisoners have tested positive for HIV at the district jail in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki, officials said on Monday. Of those infected, two prisoners are undergoing anti-retroviral treatment at Dr Ram Manohar Lohia hospital in Lucknow, a jailor said. The district's Chief Medical Officer said that efforts are being made to test all the prisoners for HIV.

337.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of roads to avoid today due to waterlogging
337.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police issued advisory asking people to avoid certain roads due to severe waterlogging and suggested alternative roads for commuters. The police diverted traffic from road near Ecospace of Outer Ring Road (ORR) and also asked people to avoid Channasandra road and Sarjapur road. The HSR Traffic Police asked commuters to take alternative roads like Hosur road.

338.title: Met Arshdeep's family, we all stand firmly with him: AAP MP
338.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday met Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh's family in Punjab after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan on Sunday. "We all stand firmly with Arsh," Chadha tweeted. "I...met bowling superstar Arshdeep's family in Kharar, Punjab. His struggle...from humble origins to playing for India on international stage is inspiring," he added.

339.title: 2 posing as police personnel rob Sudanese national in Gurugram, booked
339.article_body: Two unidentified suspects have been booked for allegedly robbing a Sudanese national in Gurugram's Sector-38. According to police, Mohammad Mustafa was targeted in front of a private hospital on Saturday. The accused, posing as police officers, took Mustafa's bag on the pretext of checking it and fled with â¹20,000 cash, some Dollars and Dirham, police added.

340.title: Pune to release aid of â¹5.88 crore for rain relief, rehabilitation
340.article_body: Following heavy rainfall between June 1 and August 31 in Pune, the district's disaster management department has announced an aid of â¹5.88 crore to farmers for relief and rehabilitation. The District Disaster Management Officer said that during the three-month period, four people died, 479 homes and huts were damaged and 297 villages were affected where crops were damaged.

341.title: 2 children aged 14 drown, 1 missing in Jharkhand waterfall
341.article_body: At least two children, both aged 14, drowned and one went missing in a waterfall in Jharkhand's Koderma on Monday, police said. The incident took place when the three friends went to Vrindaha waterfall in the Telaiya Police Station area. Notably, this comes after a 24-year-old woman and a 16-year-old girl drowned in the Damodar river on Sunday in Ramgarh.

342.title: 22-yr-old woman returning from work falls in waterlogged Bengaluru road, electrocuted
342.article_body: A 22-year-old woman named Akhila, who worked as a receptionist at a private firm in Bengaluru, died due to electrocution on Monday night. The incident occurred when she was returning home after work on her scooter and fell down on a waterlogged road. "She came in contact with an electric wire when she fell resulting in her death," police said.

343.title: Clash erupts after Dalit girl harassed in UP, dozens injured
343.article_body: A clash erupted between two groups after a Dalit girl was harassed by some young men while she was returning home from tuition in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Monday, said police. The two groups pelted stones at each other, leaving at least a dozen injured. Some of the injured suffered severe wounds, according to police.

344.title: Private hospitals run like businesses, can't ask govt for security: SC
344.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday stated private hospitals and nursing homes operate like business enterprises and charge exorbitantly, adding they can't expect the Centre and State to provide security for private players. The apex court was hearing a plea stating that doctors and healthcare workers are vulnerable to attacks and emphasised having a mechanism for their security.

345.title: 35 killed after a bus struck an explosive device in Burkina Faso
345.article_body: A bus struck an improvised explosive device in Burkina Faso, killing 35 civilians and leaving 37 injured. The escorted supply convoy was heading to Ouagadougou with traders and students onboard, residents reportedly said. The convoy hit the explosive device between the towns of Djibo and Bourzanga, an area where militants escalated attacks on villages, police and military outposts since 2015.

346.title: Putin buying artillery shells, rockets from North Korea amid war in Ukraine
346.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, Russian President Vladimir Putin is purchasing an increasing amount of arms and ammunition from ally North Korea as it feels the impact of western sanctions, according to US intelligence. Russia is buying artillery shells and rockets, according to a New York Times report. However, the US intelligence did not reveal the numbers purchased by Russia.

347.title: Always against politics messing up with sports: Digvijaya on Arshdeep
347.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Tuesday said he has always been against politics and politicians "messing up" with sports. His statement came after Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan during India's five-wicket defeat. "This can happen with the best of cricketersâ¦Subject him to such malafide campaign is outrageous," Digvijaya tweeted.

348.title: Japan to spend over $12 million on ex-PM Abe's state funeral
348.article_body: Japan will spend over $12 million on the state funeral for the former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, according to the government's new estimates. The ceremony, which will be held on September 27 at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan hall, will be attended by over 6,000 guests including 190 foreign delegations. According to Chief Cabinet Secretary, the security fee will reach $5.6 million.

349.title: Is Maha govt waiting for auspicious day for policy on clean school toilets: HC
