349.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday asked Maharashtra state government if it was powerless or waiting for some auspicious day to frame a policy on the condition of toilets in schools. The court was hearing a plea filed by two students who stated Centre and State haven't implemented effective menstrual hygiene management. The plea stated washrooms were unclean in government-aided schools.

350.title: Thrissur, Nilambur & Warangal join UNESCO Global Network of Learning Cities
350.article_body: Kerala's Thrissur and Nilambur and Telangana's Warangal have joined the UNESCO Global Network of Learning Cities (GNLC), India at UNESCO has tweeted. UNESCO GNLC is an international policy-oriented network providing inspiration, know-how and best practice. Union Minister G Kishan Reddy congratulated Telangana and Warangal, saying that it's the state's "second recognition in...one year by UNESCO".

351.title: Himachal govt approves 6-month child adoption leave for women staff members
351.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh government has approved six-month child adoption leave for its regular women employees. The state cabinet approved the policy at a meeting that was chaired by state Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur. The government said that the nod for the leave has been given by adopting Rule 43-B of CCS (Leave) Rules, 1972.

352.title: Make love, not war: Russia-born man after marrying Ukrainian in India
352.article_body: A 37-year-old Russia-born man, Sergey Novikov, and his 28-year-old Ukrainian girlfriend, Alona Burmaka, registered their marriage in Dharamshala on Monday. On the occasion, Novikov said, "Once Russia and Ukraine were one nation, like brothers. We need to make love, not war." "When we came to India, we decided to marry...We like India and its culture," said the bride.

353.title: Police arrest man who became bogus surety for accused in Chandigarh
353.article_body: Chandigarh Police has arrested a man who became the false surety of accused in different district courts of Punjab and Chandigarh and helped them secure bail. The incident came to light after a man complained to police saying someone impersonated him to become bailiff of an accused arrested in a drugs case. The victim's Aadhaar number had been forged.

354.title: Shiv Sena will retain power in BMC despite BJP's plots: Ambadas Danve
354.article_body: Shiv Sena's Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Council, Ambadas Danve, said Maharashtra's new generation will remain with Shiv Sena despite BJP's machinations. "Shiv Sena will retain...power in BMC," he added. His remarks came after Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Eknath Shinde led-Shiv Sena and BJP will win 150 seats in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

355.title: File case against those defacing metro pillars with posters: Pune Metro to police
355.article_body: The Pune Metro has directed the local police to register cases against those defacing metro pillars with posters and other publicity materials. "We cannot keep a continuous watch on miscreants, so we have written to the local police as well as PMC...It is unfortunate that a few people are defacing metro property," Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation MD said.

356.title: PM Modi receives Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina at Rashtrapati Bhavan
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday received Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina as she arrived at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Sheikh Hasina began her four-day visit to India on Monday. "Our main focus is to develop our people's federation...I feel our two countries work together...people not only in India and Bangladesh but across South Asia can get better lives," she said.

357.title: 'Double XL' is very close to my heart, I'm proud of the film: Huma
357.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, speaking about her upcoming film 'Double XL', said that it's a film which is "very close" to her heart. "A film should have been made on this [subject] long ago. But we didn't make it, I do not know why. But I am very proud of that film," she added. The film will also star Sonakshi Sinha.

358.title: India sees 4,417 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since June; positivity rate drops to 1.20%
358.article_body: India has reported 4,417 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since June 2022, and 23 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,910 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 52,336, while the daily positivity rate declined to 1.20%.

359.title: Typhoon Hinnamnor leaves 20,000 homes without power in South Korea
359.article_body: Thousands of people were forced to evacuate as Typhoon Hinnamnor made landfall in South Korea on Tuesday. The typhoon has destroyed trees and roads, forced hundreds of flight cancellations and left more than 20,000 homes without power. South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol convened response meetings and urged officials to take precautions until the typhoon is completely gone.

360.title: Right time for Sri Lanka to be at their peak: Jaffer ahead of SL-India match
360.article_body: Ahead of the India-Sri Lanka match in Asia Cup today, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's the right time for the Dasun Shanaka-led side to be at their peak in the ongoing Asia Cup. "Looking at how they defeated Bangladesh and...Afghanistan...Sri Lanka's standards are touching a high," he added. Sri Lanka had lost to Afghanistan in the group stage.

361.title: I used to play Deepika, Khushi played SRK from 'Om..': Janhvi on childhood days
361.article_body: While talking about her childhood days, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she and her sister Khushi Kapoor used to enact scene from 'Om Shanti Om'. "I used to also play the role of Deepika Padukone, and Khushi used to play the role of Shah Rukh Khan. We used to enact the scene...where Deepika waves at the audience," she added.

362.title: BJP, RSS gang is 'tukde-tukde gang' in real sense, says Congress
362.article_body: Congress spokesperson Ragini Nayak said BJP and RSS are the real "tukde-tukde gang" in the country. "I think that if there's a 'tukde-tukde gang' in a real sense in the country which is conspiring and ruining the social harmony, federal structure and democratic values to do 'tukde-tukde' of the country, it's the gang of BJP and Sangh," Nayak added.

363.title: Duo held for stealing cigarettes, medicines from delivery executives in Mumbai
363.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two people for allegedly following wholesale medicine delivery executives and stealing entire consignments. The police started a probe against the duo after a carton of 990 cigarettes was stolen on August 25. "The duo specialised in stealing medicines, knowing that they fetch a high price on black market, with other products like cigarettes," the police said.

364.title: Sensex jumps 300 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
364.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday with Sensex rising 300 points to 59,540 and Nifty at 17,747, up by 81 points. NTPC, IndusInd Bank, Reliance, Maruti, PowerGrid and Bharti Airtel were among the major gainers on BSE, while stocks of ITC, Wipro and Nestle India slipped. Buying was seen in power, realty, capital goods and auto stocks.

365.title: After 2024 polls we'll see non-BJP flag unfurled in India: KCR
365.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday said, "In 2024, we will see BJP-mukt Bharat. For this country, we should fight from Telangana." While addressing a gathering in Nizamabad, Rao added, "After 2024 Lok Sabha polls, we will see a non-BJP flag unfurled in India. We will send BJP to their home and will form a government in Delhi."

366.title: You put 6 airbags in exported cars then why just 4 in Indian units: Gadkari to car makers
366.article_body: Speaking in reference to the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry in a road accident, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari questioned car manufacturers. He said, "The same manufacturers put six airbags when they export those cars. Then why do you put only four airbags in Indian cars?" He added that the cost of increasing an airbag is â¹900.

367.title: Sachin Pilot urges Congress workers to not 'pull each other down'
367.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday urged party workers to not indulge in making "foul remarks" if they can't speak good about anyone. "We need to become each other's strength rather than pull each other down," he said. He also addressed the general public, saying, "If we can't shout slogans to cheer someone, let us at least not oppose them."

368.title: Who is Liz Truss, the leader who defeated Indian-origin Sunak in the UK PM race?
368.article_body: Liz Truss, the leader who defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race, studied philosophy, politics and economics at Merton College, Oxford. Truss has served as Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, and the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs in the past. She also worked in the energy and telecommunications industry for 10 years.

369.title: Mumbai man plans own robbery, held with partner who ran away with â¹13.75 lakh
369.article_body: Sumit Wadekar, an employee of a chartered accountancy firm in Mumbai was arrested for allegedly planning his own robbery along with his accomplice. The accomplice had, as per their plan, put a handkerchief on Wadekar's mouth and made him unconscious, following which, he ran away with â¹13.75 lakh. CCTV footage showed the two speaking to each other in sign language.

370.title: Over 27,000 Ganesh idols immersed in 5 days in Pune
370.article_body: A total of 27,375 Ganesh idols were immersed by the end of the fifth day of Ganeshotsav in Pune, with at least 15,832 of them being done on Sunday, said officials. The number is less as compared to last year, when at least 56,596 idols had been immersed by the fifth day of the festival, added officials.

371.title: Lalit Modi changes Instagram bio, sparks rumours of breakup with Sushmita Sen
371.article_body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has changed his Instagram bio, sparking rumours of breakup with Sushmita Sen. "Founder @iplt20 INDIAN PREMIER LEAGUE - finally starting a new life with my partner in crime. My love @sushmitasen47," his bio read until last week. However, on Monday, Lalit's Instagram bio dropped Sushmita's mention and read, "Founder @iplt20 INDIAN PREMIER LEAGUE - Moon."

372.title: Bengaluru Metro denied permission to cut more trees for now
372.article_body: The Karnataka High Court denied Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) permission to cut down more trees until it submits a status report on alternative plants raised earlier. The court gave BBMP two weeks time to file a report on the condition of compensatory plantation and dislocation of trees. This comes after BMRCL sought permission for felling 382 trees.

373.title: Russia jails ex-journalist Ivan Safronov for 22 years for treason
373.article_body: A Russian court has sentenced ex-journalist Ivan Safronov to 22 years in prison for treason. Ivan Safronov was accused of passing military secrets to Czech spies. He has denied the charges, claiming that information he allegedly shared with Czech foreign intelligence was all public and open source. Earlier, Safronov rejected a plea deal, which could have almost halved his sentence.

374.title: Arya Samaj certificates not enough to prove marriage, wedding must be registered: HC
374.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has observed that certificates issued by Arya Samaj Societies alone do not prove the legality of a marriage, saying the wedding should also be registered. While dealing with a habeas corpus petition, the High Court said, "The said institution has misused their beliefs in organising the marriages without even considering the genuineness of documents."

375.title: upGrad CEO shares video of him going to office on a tractor amid B'luru flooding
375.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's CEO Arjun Mohan has shared a video of him going to the office on a tractor amid heavy rainfall in Bengaluru. "I had to walk 7km, take a tractor to cross waist deep water and hitch rides from...bikers," Mohan wrote on LinkedIn. He clarified that he went to office because there was no electricity at his home.

376.title: Being called someone's girlfriend used to bother me: Actress Asha Negi
376.article_body: Actress Asha Negi said it used to bother her on being labelled someone's girlfriend and added she also has her own identity. "I've learnt that it's very important to keep your life private as much as you can...I've been here in the industry for some time now," she stated. Asha dated actor Rithvik Dhanjani, however, they broke up in 2020.

377.title: RIL acquires 79.4% stake in US-based solar software firm SenseHawk for $32m
377.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired a 79.4% stake in US-based SenseHawk Inc through primary infusion and secondary purchase, for $32 million (â¹255 crore), the company said in a BSE filing. Founded in 2018, SenseHawk develops software-based management tools for the solar energy generation industry. While the transaction will be completed by 2022-end, the deal marks RIL's foray into new energy.

378.title: Should have picked Deepak Chahar as Jadeja's replacement: Karim
378.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said pacer Deepak Chahar should've replaced Ravindra Jadeja in India's squad for the Asia Cup. "We already had three spinners in the squad...Chahar is a specialist in the T20 format and is a wicket-taker," stated Karim. Jadeja was replaced by Axar Patel after he was ruled out due to a right knee injury.

379.title: Pune women gang that stole mobile phones during Ganesh festival busted
379.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a women gang that stole mobile phones during the Ganesh festival and arrested its four members. Police recovered four mobile phones, worth â¹97,000, from them. "These women are habitual offenders and visit the city during big festivals like Ganpati, where large crowds come on the streets. They stay on footpaths...later sell the phones," police stated.

380.title: 2 die, 1 injured after overspeeding bike hits divider in Navi Mumbai
380.article_body: Two people died and one was seriously injured after their motorbike hit a divider on Palm Beach Road in Navi Mumbai. The incident reportedly occurred at around 11 pm on Sunday. According to police, the motorbike was being driven at a very high speed, which led to the accident. The injured person is being treated at a hospital, reports said.

381.title: Noise level crosses 'danger' mark in Mumbai during Ganpati Visarjan: NGO
381.article_body: The drums and loudspeakers used during Ganpati Visarjan this year contributed to making the noise level the highest ever in Mumbai, crossing the 'danger' mark, a city-based NGO said. According to data shared by Awaaz Foundation, the combination of drums and banjo used in processions created the highest noise at 115.6dB at Marine Drive's Babulnath corner and 112.1dB in Bandra.

382.title: People think back-seaters don't need belt: Gadkari after Cyrus Mistry's death
382.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said the mindset of the common man needs to change to increase road safety. He said, "People think back-seaters don't need belts. It is the problem." Police probe into former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death in the road accident on Sunday revealed he was in the backseat and was not wearing a seat belt.

383.title: 'No': US Prez Biden on designating Russia as state sponsor of terror
383.article_body: On being asked if Russia should be designated a state sponsor of terrorism, US President Joe Biden told reporters at the White House, "No." Ukraine's government has asked its Western partners to designate Russia as a "terrorist state" amid Moscow's ongoing invasion. Earlier, Russia had warned the US that such designation would rupture ties between both countries.

384.title: He kept a low profile despite his success: Shapoorji Pallonji Group on Mistry's death
384.article_body: After the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry in a road accident, Shapoorji Pallonji Group shared a condolence letter on social media. It wrote, "CPM, as he was fondly known, was a voracious reader, committed to a journey of lifelong learning across multiple disciplines. Despite his success, he always kept a low profile, away from the limelight."

385.title: Telugu is the new Hindi: RGV on 'Brahmastra' promotions in South
385.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter and talked about the promotions of 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad involving 'Baahubali' director SS Rajamouli and 'RRR' actor Jr NTR. "Going by Rajamouli and Jr NTR at the 'Brahmastra' event, Telugu is the new Hindi," Varma tweeted. 'Brahmastra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna. The film will release on September 9.

386.title: ATM refilling van driver flees with â¹2.80 cr cash in Mumbai, booked
386.article_body: The driver of an ATM refilling van allegedly fled with â¹2.80 crore cash in the vehicle in Mumbai on Monday. The incident occurred around 12.20 pm when the van reached Union Bank of India in Goregaon (west) and the employees got off the van to refill the ATM, police said. An FIR has been filed in connection with the case.

387.title: Pune residents asked to update Aadhaar, Collector calls for drive
387.article_body: Residents in Pune have been asked to update their information on Aadhaar. District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh on Monday called for a drive in this regard. "Many citizens have changed their addresses. Hence, we appeal to all residents to update information," said Deshmukh. Notably, Pune is one of the 40 districts selected by the central government for updating Aadhaar cards.

388.title: 2 members of drug cartel held in Delhi, 4.2 kg heroin worth â¹21 cr seized
388.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two members of an interstate drug cartel and seized 4.2 kilograms of heroin worth â¹21 crore. The cartel allegedly supplied more than 100 kilograms of heroin in Delhi in the past two years, police said. One of the accused used to prepare heroin in his village in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, police further said.

389.title: Man running India-Pak cricket betting racket arrested in Pune
389.article_body: Pune City Police's crime branch unit 3 has arrested a 24-year-old man who was running a cricket betting racket during the India-Pakistan match. The arrest was made after police officers patrolling in Kothrud got a tip-off that the accused was standing near a pub, police said. Previously, the accused was arrested for running a betting racket in Pimpri-Chinchwad, police added.

390.title: Lucknow's Hotel Levana to be sealed, demolished after 4 people killed in fire
390.article_body: Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow will be sealed and demolished, following the death of four people in a fire that broke out at the hotel on Monday. The owners of the hotel have been detained. Rescue work had started soon after fire broke out. Reports said that the hotel operators had not taken the NOC of the fire department.

391.title: Bengaluru reports 276 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
391.article_body: Bengaluru reported 276 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,66,836 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 3,228, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.57%.

392.title: Highest rainfall in B'luru in 32 yrs; K'taka govt releases â¹300 cr to tackle flooding
392.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that Bengaluru has received the highest rainfall in the last 32 years. The state government has decided to release â¹300 crore to tackle the flooding in Bengaluru amid heavy rain, he added. The released money will be used to restore infrastructure such as roads, electric poles, transformers and schools, among others, Bommai stated.

393.title: One suspect in Canada mass stabbing that killed 10 found dead
393.article_body: Canada police have said that one of the two suspects in Sunday's mass stabbing in Saskatchewan has been found dead. The other suspect, his brother, was still on the run and may be injured, officials added. The brothers Damien and Myles Sanderson are suspected of murdering 10 people and wounding 18 in the attack that targeted an indigenous community.

394.title: Russia permanently bans 25 Americans, including Sean Penn, from entering the country
394.article_body: Russia imposed personal sanctions on 25 Americans, including actors Sean Penn and Ben Stiller, in response to US sanctions against Russians amid Ukraine war. Russia said the group, which also includes business leaders, academics and government officials, would be banned permanently from entering Russia. Notably, Penn and Stiller previously traveled to Ukraine and met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

395.title: Heard of Piastri-McLaren contract later than July 4 date: Alpine F1
395.article_body: Alpine F1 boss Otmar Szafnauer said they got to know about Oscar Piastri and McLaren's contract much later than the July 4 date they claimed to have signed the deal. "Up until that point, it was just conjecture," said Szafnauer, adding they were pursuing their contract with Piastri. An F1 Board recently ruled in favour of Piastri's contract with McLaren.

396.title: Priti Patel resigns as UK Home Secretary hours after Liz Truss named PM
396.article_body: Britain's Home Secretary Priti Patel on Monday announced she's stepping down from her post, hours after Liz Truss was named the Prime Minister. "I congratulate Liz Truss on being elected our new Leader, and will give her my support as our new Prime Minister," said Patel in her resignation letter. "It's my choice to continue...public service...from the backbenches," said Patel.

397.title: SEBI gives in-principle approval to Helios Capital for mutual fund business
397.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given in-principle approval to Helios Capital to launch a mutual fund business. The portfolio management services business, Helios Capital Management PTE Limited, applied for a mutual fund license in February 2021. Founder and Fund Manager Samir Arora announced the approval on Twitter and added that they will focus on performance and service.

398.title: With Medvedev out, Nadal leading race to end US Open as world no. 1
398.article_body: Daniil Medvedev is set to be replaced as world number one by Rafael Nadal, Carlos Alcaraz or Casper Ruud after the US Open. With Medvedev losing to Nick Kyrgios in the Round of 16, Rafael Nadal would become the top-ranked player if he reaches the finals. Ruud or Alcaraz could also take the spot if they win the tournament.

399.title: Tripura CM meets PM Modi, discusses state issues
399.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. Saha said that he told the PM about the progress of various projects in health, education, commerce, infrastructure development and ongoing projects of central and state governments. "Hon'ble PM assured about extending Centre's necessary assistance for overall development in Tripura," Saha wrote on Twitter.

400.title: Macron urges French to save energy amid EU-Russia tensions
400.article_body: Amid tensions between Russia and the EU over the war in Ukraine, French President Emmanuel Macron has urged the people of his country to adopt energy-saving measures in order to avoid power cuts during winter. Macron on Monday warned that power rationing could be introduced if voluntary efforts don't suffice. He added that "cuts will happen as a last resort".

401.title: Minimum 2 more years in F1, then Dakar Rally: Fernando Alonso
401.article_body: Two-time F1 world champion Fernando Alonso said he wishes to continue in the sport for a minimum of two more years. "And then, from there, a challenge that I have never hidden is to try the Dakar (Rally) again," said Alonso. He added that he was moving to Aston Martin from Alpine next year because he felt more wanted there.

402.title: Getting threats for doing Ganesh Puja at home: UP BJP's Ruby Khan
402.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Muslim BJP leader Ruby Asif Khan allegedly received death threats for bringing home and worshipping a Ganesh idol. A fatwa has also reportedly been issued against her by Deoband Mufti Arshad Farooqui who called her action 'un-Islamic'. Stating that she is not afraid of the threats, she said she would also immerse the Ganesh idol with due diligence.

403.title: Real Madrid's Brazilian attacker Vinicius Jr adopts Spain citizenship
403.article_body: Real Madrid attacker Vinicius Junior, who holds a Brazilian passport, has now also adopted Spanish citizenship. Under La Liga rules, a club can only have five non-EU players in their squad, thus Vinicius' move helps free up a spot for Real Madrid. Reports claim players Rodrygo Goes and Eder Militao are also in the process of obtaining their Spanish passports.

404.title: 'India's biggest car thief' who stole over 5,000 cars in 24 years, arrested in Delhi
404.article_body: An auto theft kingpin, whom the police referred to as "India's biggest car thief", was arrested by Delhi Police on Monday. Anil Chauhan, who started stealing cars in 1998, has looted over 5,000 cars across the country and police found illegal firearms and ammunition with him. Around 180 criminal cases including rhino horn smuggling and murders are registered against him.

405.title: Ukrainian PM asks EU for more weapons, offers gas supplies
405.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Monday urged the EU to provide Ukraine with more weapons in order to strengthen its capabilities in the ongoing war against Russia. Shmyhal further suggested that Ukraine could supply the gas that the EU needs to reduce its dependence on Russia. Notably, Russia last week indefinitely suspended gas supply to Europe through a key pipeline.

406.title: Contractual Army cook arrested for stalking minor on social media
406.article_body: A 21-year-old contractual cook of the Indian Army was arrested by Delhi Police for allegedly stalking and harassing a 17-year-old girl on social media after she ended their friendship. The girl had befriended him through TikTok and exchanged numbers, police said. The accused allegedly created her multiple fake accounts on social media platforms and made vulgar posts using her pictures.
